    • Method Detail

      • afterWrite

        protected void afterWrite(int n)
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from class: ProxyWriter
        Invoked by the write methods after the proxied call has returned successfully. The number of chars written (1 for the ProxyWriter.write(int) method, buffer length for ProxyWriter.write(char[]), etc.) is given as an argument.

        Subclasses can override this method to add common post-processing functionality without having to override all the write methods. The default implementation does nothing.

        Overrides:
        afterWrite in class ProxyWriter
        Parameters:
        n - number of chars written
        Throws:
        IOException - if the post-processing fails

      • writeLine

        public abstract void writeLine(String line)
                        throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException
